page.title: 07THE MORAVIAN CHAPEL
page.content: During the 19th century Baltonsborough Parish Church was thought to be too Anglo_Catholic for many of its parishioners. An abortive appeal to the Squire of Butleigh led to approaches being made to all non-conformist churches. The Moravians showed interest and the chapel was built in 1852 with finance from three local men. The Manse was built in 1859 and in 1861 a school was built which sixty children attended. The Moravian community broke up in 1963,the school closed and the Manse and the chapel are now private houses. One resident is still eligible for burial in the Moravian cemetery, now a garden.
